    • Method Detail

      • handleHandshake

        void handleHandshake​(boolean chat,
                     boolean challenge,
                     boolean leaderboard,
                     java.lang.String playerName)
              throws ServerUnavailableException,
                     ExitProgram
        When a client first connects to the server, it sends a hello message, which. includes some information about itself and the player: HELLO + DELIMITER + supports chat + DELIMITER + supports challenge + DELIMITER + supports leaderboard + DELIMITER + player name + EOC
        Throws:
        ExitProgram - when the programming is going to exit
        ServerUnavailableException

      • joinQueue

        void joinQueue​(int gamesize)
        throws ServerUnavailableException,
               ExitProgram
        After the handshake, clients should join one of three queues, either for 2, 3. or 4-player games: JOIN + DELIMITER + + EOC
        Parameters:
        gamesize - What kind of game to join, either a 2, 3 or 4-player game
        Throws:
        ExitProgram - When IO exception
        ServerUnavailableException

      • sendMove

        void sendMove​(java.lang.String playerName,
              java.lang.String direction,
              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> marbleIndices)
       throws ServerUnavailableException
        When the client has come up with a move, it sends it to the server: MOVE + DELIMITER + player name + DELIMITER + direction + DELIMITER + index of field (multiple times) + EOC All marbles involved in the move should be included, each separated by DELIMITER.
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player that made this move
        direction - The direction that the line of marbles should move to.
        marbleIndices - All indices of the marbles involved in this move. The order of the indices does not matter.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException

      • getCurrentQueueSizes

        void getCurrentQueueSizes()
                   throws ServerUnavailableException
        The client can always query the server for the current queue sizes, no matter. its current state: QUEUE_SIZE + EOC
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException

      • sendExit

        void sendExit()
       throws ServerUnavailableException
        When a client wants to exit, it should inform the server:. EXIT + EOC
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException
